Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the nature of the UGLOC study as described in the consent form?
A) The UGLOC study is a commercial product trial.
B) The UGLOC study is a non-research related public survey.
C) The UGLOC study is a Randomised Controlled Trial for research purposes.
D) The UGLOC study is a retrospective patient record review.

Correct answer: C) The UGLOC study is a Randomised Controlled Trial for research purposes.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary objective of the UGLOC research study?
A) To evaluate the effectiveness of a new diet plan for weight loss; B) To assess the impact of intra-operative ultrasound guidance on fertility preservation during ovarian cystectomy; C) To compare different surgical techniques for appendectomy; D) To study the long-term effects of taking multivitamins on ovarian health

Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
For how long is each participant expected to be involved in the UGLOC study?
A) Until the study is completed, with no specified time frame; B) For a duration determined by the individual's recovery time; C) For a specific period that is mentioned in the consent form; D) For the duration of their hospital stay only

Correct answer: C) For a specific period that is mentioned in the consent form

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the potential additional costs for participating in the UGLOC study?
A) Participants will be charged for any additional treatments or procedures required by the study.
B) Participants will incur additional costs for travel and accommodation related to the study.
C) There are no mentions of additional costs to the participants in the consent form provided.
D) Participants will be reimbursed for any additional costs incurred as a result of the study.

Correct answer: C) There are no mentions of additional costs to the participants in the consent form provided.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
Which of the following statements accurately describes the consent process for the UGLOC study according to the new consent form?
A) Participants are required to give permission for the research team to contact their GP with details of their participation and post-operative follow-up findings.
B) Participants are automatically enrolled in future research studies without their explicit consent.
C) Participants can only withdraw from the study if they provide a valid reason and it may affect their medical care.
D) Participants are not required to consent to being contacted at the end of the study to receive a leaflet with the study's findings and results.

Correct answer: A) Participants are required to give permission for the research team to contact their GP with details of their participation and post-operative follow-up findings.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
If you choose to withdraw from the UGLOC study, what will be the impact on your medical care or legal rights?
A) Your medical care will be discontinued; B) Your legal rights will be affected; C) Your medical care and legal rights will remain unaffected; D) You will be required to provide a reason for your withdrawal

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the UGLOC Randomised Controlled Trial?
A) 50; B) 100; C) 150; D) The consent form does not specify the number of participants.
Correct answer: D

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort that participants may experience in the UGLOC study?
A) Exposure to high levels of radiation; B) Discomfort from the use of intra-operative ultrasound equipment; C) Risk of allergic reactions to anesthesia; D) None of the above are mentioned as risks in the consent form.

Correct answer: D

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit of participating in the UGLOC study as described in the consent form?
A) Guaranteed fertility preservation
B) Possible improvement in fertility preservation techniques
C) Financial compensation for participation
D) Immediate improvement in overall health

Correct answer: B) Possible improvement in fertility preservation techniques

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
If you decide not to participate in the UGLOC study, what alternative treatment option is available for the management of benign ovarian cysts?
A) Standard laparoscopic ovarian cystectomy without ultrasound guidance; B) No treatment will be provided for benign ovarian cysts; C) Immediate full hysterectomy as a precautionary measure; D) Mandatory participation in a different research study

Correct answer: A

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
Who is authorized to access your medical records for the purpose of this research study according to the consent form?
A) Only the Principal Investigator; B) Members of the research team and regulatory authorities; C) All staff members at Imperial College London; D) Only your General Practitioner (GP)
Correct answer: B

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What does the new consent form indicate about compensation and medical treatment if a participant is injured during the study?
A) Participants will receive financial compensation for any injury sustained during the study.
B) The consent form does not mention any compensation or medical treatment for injuries.
C) Participants will be provided with free medical treatment for any injuries sustained.
D) The consent form specifies that participants will be directed to where they can obtain further information about compensation and medical treatments for injuries.

Correct answer: B) The consent form does not mention any compensation or medical treatment for injuries.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you have any questions about your rights as a research subject or wish to discuss problems or concerns related to the study, whom should you contact?
A) The Research Governance and Integrity Team; B) The Principal Investigator, Mr Joseph Yazbek; C) Your General Practitioner (GP); D) The regulatory authorities

Correct answer: B) The Principal Investigator, Mr Joseph Yazbek

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your ability to withdraw from the UGLOC study?

A) Withdrawing from the study will result in a loss of medical care benefits.
B) Participation is mandatory once consent is given.
C) You can withdraw at any time without affecting your medical care or legal rights.
D) Withdrawing from the study requires providing a reason to the research team.

Correct answer: C) You can withdraw at any time without affecting your medical care or legal rights.
